name: Sea Breeze Cafe Ceningan
address: Ceningan Kawan, Jl. Nusa Ceningan, Lembongan, Kec. Nusa Penida, Kabupaten Klungkung, Bali 80771, Indonesia
review 1:
Highly recommended! ‚úÖ
Choose this spot based on photos of the ambiance and the high ratings. The staff were welcoming and friendly.

The food is near the top of any I‚Äôve had during my Bali visit. We ordered the chicken with mushrooms sauce and the aromatic seafood and chicken satay. And for drinks, peach mint iced teas. Which were super freshening and natural, not sweetened.

They played live music which created a great atmosphere.

Would definitely recommend this spot. üëåüèΩ
review 2:
You walk across the yellow bridge to Ceningan and then stroll along a dirt road behind the restaurants / bars, getting glimpses of the view between the trees.
Sea Breeze is a brilliant spot to rest after a walk.
You could spend hours gazing across the water.
The food is excellent, and the drinks are cheap.
Such a bargain, we thought we'd been undercharged.
review 3:
Great place with an amazing view, Good price for okay prices.

Even has a little beach a pool on sight.

Borderline big menu though. But it‚Äôs something for everyone here!

There‚Äôs a lot of cute dogs here‚Äôs as wellüòÄ
review 4: What can I say? A MUST VISIT!!!! The pool area, the view, the vibe, the people, the food. For lunch we had grilled chicken and chicken satay. Both delicious. We heard sunset is amazing so staying here for dinner too!
review 5:
Nice restaurant, too many flies. The moment our food was served we got swarmed by flies. It ruined our mood.

The restaurant is a quirky crossover, half restaurant, half beach club with a nice pool area and a pool bar.

The service was somewhat slow, while there were only 6 customers, and we were the only people that had ordered food, we ended up waiting 30 minutes for our food to arrive.

The food was tasty although hard to enjoy due to the large number of flies that arrived with the food.

There is a 11% tax added to your bill and an extra 3% charge if you opt to pay by credit card.

It seems like a nice place.

name: Song Tepo Beach
address: Ceningan Island, Lembongan, Kec. Nusa Penida, Kabupaten Klungkung, Bali 80771, Indonesia
review 1: Whether you will see the sand to call it a beach depends on the tide. But the best place to get access to the channel between Lembongan and Ceningan for swimming, with its turquoise water and seaweed farms. Plenty of little restaurants at this coast, some with pool. Very relaxed atmosphere.
review 2:
The sun on your skin, the freshness of a sea wind, the smell of the sea weeds. No traffic, no noises, no pollution. Relax, a lot of pure and enjoyable relax.
Wonderful view and amazing sunsets. This is Song Tepo Beach. A place where everyday is different due to the sea level which constantly change.
A small paradise far (but not too far) from the chaotic Seminyak/Kuta/Canggu areas!

For more pictures or infos please follow me on Instagram @simonegiammarinaro! Thanks!
review 3: Clear water, beautiful view. There are many cute restaurants where you can chill and enjoy the view.
review 4: Very clear water, but mainly used for seaweed farms, so not inviting for swimming. Many bars and restaurants along the shore.
review 5: Wasnt really a beach where we could swim with the low tide. However beautiful view of the seaweed farminf

name: MyBeach Warung And Bar
address: Jl. Nusa Ceningan, Lembongan, Kec. Nusa Penida, Kabupaten Klungkung, Bali 80771, Indonesia
review 1: I had an incredible dining experience at this restaurant! The ambiance was cozy and clean, enhancing the deliciousness of the food. The staff provided friendly and professional service, making our visit exceptionally enjoyable. Their menu offers a variety of options, and the dishes we ordered were incredibly tasty and fresh. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking a remarkable culinary experience!
review 2: I really enjoyed my time here. Friendly staff, mellow music, and a great view of seaweed farms (low tide). The sunset was beautiful. The smoothie bowl was delicious!
review 3:
Very nice spot with a beautiful view, a pool and 2 swings with a little hammock just in front, right on the water.

We stopped for lunch and decided to spend a few hours there, either in the pool or on the bean bags.

Had the beef burger and my husband the pepes ikan (tuna steamed in banana leaf). Both very good!
review 4: Awesome atmosphere, friendly staff and a great pool/view! We particularly loved their nasi goreng and their smoothie bowls. Good happy hour too! Highly recommend spending a day here instead of an expensive beach club
review 5:
Had a relaxing dinner and some drinks. Nice location. Great for sunset. Welcoming staff and owner.

Just ask for vegan options with tofu and/or tempeh. It is delicious.

name: The View Day Club
address: Nusa Ceningan, Lembongan, Kec. Nusa Penida, Kabupaten Klungkung, Bali 80771, Indonesia
review 1: The best views on the Island  overlooking Nusa Lembogan and Bali.  So beautiful. Great food. stunning pool, and superb service. A must do  You will love it
review 2: Guys, I had the BEST time ever here. Happy hour, stunning sunset, amazing pool, good cocktails, best vibes! We also had dinner here, and it was really tasty.
review 3: Spectacular view, amazing food. Had a wonderful afternoon hanging out in the pool.  Took the owner 5 years to build just before Covid hit. Get up there and give them your support, its well worth it.
review 4: Amazing views, the best place for a sunset in Bali,  the staff are so friendly and the food was great. Well worth the trek up the hill.
review 5:
Amazing Day Club! The pool is great and the staff is very friendly. They also have towels available (included if you get a sun bed, which was very low minimum consumption).
If you don‚Äôt want to swim, it‚Äôs still worth coming and enjoying a cold drink upstairs.
Yes, the prices might be a tiny bit higher but the view you get is priceless!

name: The Island Ceningan Beach Bar
address: Jl. Nusa Ceningan, Lembongan, Kec. Nusa Penida, Kabupaten Klungkung, Bali 80771, Indonesia
review 1: Such a lovely place to watch the sunset! Amazing happy hour - cocktails are only 50k which is a great price for Indonesia. It was so quiet when we came at 4pm we had the whole place to ourselves for an hour! Pool is very nice and the view is amazing. Definitely come here for sunset and some cocktails (mojitos were very good)
review 2: Very nice place to hang out at the pool and dip into the turquoise sea. One of a few places at this coast that gives access to the channel between Lembongan and Ceningan for swimming and relaxing. Great spot for selfies üòâ
review 3: The Island Ceningan Beach Bar is the place to be! Sure, the food portions are a tad small, but honestly, with vibes this good, who's counting calories? The service is super friendly, and the prices won't break the bank. It's the ultimate hangout spot on Ceningan Island, where you can kick back, enjoy the beach, and have a great time with friends!
review 4: A ‚ÄúMust see‚Äù restaurant. The food was amazing. The staff were sweet and helpful. There is a pool to the restaurant and a small beach too. We will come back one day.
review 5:
Very nice stop on this island. Especially in the afternoon with the sun on the bar. They have a pool and you go into the water between Lembongan and Cenigan.

To bad there were only 2 towels available if you have free towl service. My advice would be to invest in a few extra towls to give that service to all customers.

Nevertheless we really enjoyed our drinks here.

name: Yellow Bridge Home Stay
address: 8F32+XF3, Lembongan, Nusa Penida, Klungkung Regency, Bali 80771, Indonesia
review 1: Beautiful 3 month old home stay. 5 individual rooms with luxury bedding, and great AC.  Very clean, great little pool and located right at the end of the yellow bridge which is a great spot for exploring. The owners are really genuine and couldn't do more to help us. We rented scooters and booked snorkelling through them. Amazing value, a must book if they have a room.
review 2: Very worth the value! The small cottage style room is comfortable , with basic amenities provided. Equipped with AC and hot water , towels, soap and shampoo. No dryer. A really small pool and sunbath bed but it doesn't matter in this island. Simple toast and fruits and orange juice as breakfast with nice staff. You can rent motorbike in this place as well.
review 3:
Staff is superrrrrrr friendly. I have received many good advice from him to avoid the trap of locals.

The ant colony attacked my bed at midnight.
No amenities, only shampoo and shower gel.
No option for breakfast, only 2 slices of bread per person, plus a small butter and strawberry jam boxes.
review 4: Really a nice place. No TV but its okay we can stare at the stars and the sky. Helpful staff. Nearby to the jetty, boat transfer to Nusa Penida. But the swimming pool need some cleaning though
review 5: Gede was very helpful and attentive. Cleanest place in Bali so far. Shower was hot and bed sheets smell was so good. Best location too!

name: Tatak Bunut Villa Nusa Ceningan
address: Jl. Nusa Ceningan, Lembongan, Kec. Nusa Penida, Kabupaten Klungkung, Bali 80771, Indonesia
review 1: 5 beautiful villas situated in the Ceningan Hills with a great sea view. We ended up extending our time here and stayed 6 weeks in the end! Spotlessly clean rooms with TV, fridge, kettle, shower gel/shampoo, great shower pressure. Lovely, kind staff who are always happy to help. The pool and garden areas are well kept and nice to chill by with plenty of comfy sun beds and parasols. Easier to access with a scooter (available to rent) but still only a 15min walk down to waterside where restaurants and shops are if you don‚Äôt ride a bike. Breakfast is delicious and sets you up great for the day! Would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a peaceful location surrounded by greenery with an amazing view. Thank you! We will be back :)
review 2: We loved our stay at Tatak Bunut! The best sweet staff with tasty breakfast, easy scooter rental, amazing views, pool and the rooms were lovely and clean every day.  It felt like a calm haven at the top of the hill. We would love to come and stay again!
review 3: Just stayed one night in this place and didn‚Äôt expected much, but the Villa is just great! Big beds, big bathroom, everything clean and comfy. Very friendly staff, if had the chance I would stay longer. The way to the place is a bit tricky because the street is very steep and rocky but with a scooter 100% doable.
review 4: Fantastic place to stay. We were sorry we had to leave. Gede does a fabulous job of looking after you the place is spotless. They hire scooters so you can get around or you can just wing it as we did and walked the 3 bars or so up there.
review 5: Cozy little place with very nice cottages. Decent sized pool. Host family offers (limited) food options. I recommend renting a scooter, this place is quite a walk up the hills otherwise. Criminally cheap, too.

name: The Nomad Bali
address: Jl. Nusa Ceningan, Lembongan, Kec. Nusa Penida, Kabupaten Klungkung, Bali 80771, Indonesia
review 1:
Highly recommended for a specialty coffee! Absolutely great place to get an iced coffee. Owner serves the best hospitality you can ask for. Super chill, laid back place. Architecture and styling is a mix between North African and Malaisian and very beautiful! You can even buy one of the many portrait photographs on the wall.
Good to know, there is no menu. Just ask what you like and he makes it for you.
Thanks!
review 2:
Unbelievably beautiful place. Amazing atmosphere, you could spend hours here. The interior is picked out very thoughtfully and the pictures on the wall are so cool also & the music was pleasant.
The coffee is amazing (we had iced cappuccinos)!! Yes it takes some time for them to arrive (as mentioned in other reviews but we personally didn‚Äôt really think so) but this is because the owner puts a lot of detail into it and does every step by hand which makes it an even better experience.
The location is also impeccable!
review 3: Absolutely surprised to find such a gem! The coffee is top-notch. Different brewing methods to choose from, and the owner knows his coffee! We were extremely pleased with the oolong tea, as well. Such a smooth taste! And the teddy-bear-shaped ice was such a lovely addition! If you love coffee and want a great experience, come here!
review 4: This place. You step in and your breath drops. If you are on an resting, inward journey it‚Äôs the perfect place to sip the best coffee / tea, journal or read your book. The place is curated with so much love, you feel it directly. The playlist is üíñ and The owner is super welcoming and knowledgeable about the art & magic of coffee. I will be back and recommend it to all my friends.
review 5:
Wow, just wow! What a little paradise to enjoy the best coffee on the island. Enjoy the stunning view and aestethic, yet cozy, interior while having a damn good coffee.
The owners are exceptionally nice and welcoming.
Can recommend 11/10!

name: Rumah Marta Ceningan Island
address: ceningan island, Lembongan, Kec. Nusa Penida, Denpasar, Bali 80771, Indonesia
review 1: lovely room, clean and comfortable, good AC, perfect location, great swimming pool. all the staff members were very kind, helpful and smiley, even on the New Year's Day, battling the hangover hahaüòÄ
review 2:
Rumha Marta is a lovely friendly affordable Hotel .   Staff are very welcoming and friendly.
Rooms are good
Pool area is great
review 3:
This place is highly recommended to visit. I am very satisfied staying here because it is close to the beach and the people around are very friendly
anyway this place is very good‚ù§Ô∏èüåÖüèñÔ∏èüèùÔ∏è
review 4: Best place to stay in nusa ceningan recomended üëçüëç
review 5: good place to stay and hollidayüëçüèª

name: The Bridge Huts
address: Jl. Nusa Ceningan, Lembongan, Kec. Nusa Penida, Kabupaten Klungkung, Bali 80771, Indonesia
review 1:
Spent two nights here in mid-March.

Agus and his family were wonderful hosts.

Room lovely, breakfast healthy and filling.

Great location, close to Yellow Bridge, and able to walk anywhere, unless you want a scooter, that Agus could arrange.
review 2:
We stayed there for 2 nights, and had the best time in the island.
The hotel is located near everything, the room is spacious and comfy.
The view from the swimming pool is stunning, and the boss Agus is the best host we had in Bali. He is so nice and so helping with everything.
I recommand you to stay here in your trip in Nusa Ceningan.
review 3: Great place! The breakfast is included and had a good variety. The view from the pool over the sea is amazing. The huts suited all our needs with a proper bed, shower and fridge. Only the water from the shower was a bit salty.  Oh and Lilly the hotel puppy is to cute.
review 4:
So cheap for what you get! The friendliest staff! Went above and beyond for us. The comfiest bed! Perfect location for exploring the islands with a scooter. Our breakfasts each morning were lush with a gorgeous view! We loved our time here and if we were to return to Bali, this is one place we would definitely stay again! We got more than our money's worth here üëçüëçüëç
üåüüåüüåüüåüüåü
review 5: Overall, mixed feelings about the place. The hotel is nice, beautiful pool with a view at a reasonable price. Agus was very helpful in booking transfer trips from Ubud and to Gili Islands. However, all looks a bit old and not super clean: there was hair stuck in the shower stones on the floor, we found a huge cockroach on the bed the 1st night (OK that happens in tropical weathers), and a big mouse on the 2nd night ! First time in my life I experience this in a hotel, I guess we weren't lucky. We changed rooms but apologies would have been nice.

name: Sea Bridge Villa Ceningan
address: 8F32+QCH, Jl. Nusa Ceningan, Lembongan, Kec. Nusa Penida, Kabupaten Klungkung, Bali 80771, Indonesia
review 1:
I stayed at sea bridge villa for 2 nights and really enjoyed this time. The location is just after the bridge and easy to find, you can find a shop just opposite the entrance and so many cafes and bars walking distance from it.
The room had a nice sea view, it was very quiet and just what I needed.
Thank you very much for your stay here.
The owner also serve the breakfast but I always explored local cafes so can‚Äôt say anything about it.
review 2:
Stayed here after a mix-up with our pre-booked accom. This is a little gem.
This small family run hotel is right next to the Yellow Bridge.
We were well looked after by Ita (?), Wayan and Kadek. They honestly couldn‚Äôt help us enough (lifts to get money, lent us a scooter etc ($0)).
We had rooms 1,2 and 3 which were large and very clean with great aircon.
The pool is also great to wash off the heat of the day and watch the sun go down with an icey cold refreshment.
Short walk to a bunch of restaurants and a convenience store across the road.
Would I go back? Yes‚Ä¶ in a heartbeat.
Highly recommend.
review 3:
We lived here for 10 days.
We were settled in a dirty room (the refrigerator is dirty, there are spiders and dust in mugs, all the shelves are dusty). They responded to our comments quickly and tried to correct them.
There is no wardrobe and hangers in the room, there is not even a bedside table, the mosquito net above the bed is covered in dust. There is no towel hook in the bathroom.
The plumbing is all old. Water from the shower pours in all directions.
There are many mosquitoes in the room.
There are cockroaches in the bathroom.
This hotel is good for a couple of nights.
Pool is clean, nice view. Bed sheets and towels are clean and new.
The owner and staff are friendly and smiling.
You will be met and taken to the boat free of charge.
You can rent a motorbike at the hotel.
review 4: Beautiful location and the most friendly and helpful staff I have ever experienced. We had to stay an extra night as our ferries were cancelled due to bad weather. The staff went out of their way to make sure we were able to make other arrangements and helped with booking one of the only ferries the next day off the island. Everything you need is in one spot. Thank you!
review 5: Had an awesome time staying with my partner at Sea Bridge villas this week. Very central location, very friendly and helpful staff with great recommendations and a very relaxed atmosphere. Lots of good places to eat and drink close by. Staff were able to organise transport including pick up/ drop off from fast boat, scooter rental and day trips to Nusa penida. Would highly recommend Sea bridge villas for your next stay.

name: Kuun Sunset
address: 8C2W+CHG, Jl. Nusa Ceningan, Lembongan, Kec. Nusa Penida, Kabupaten Klungkung, Bali 80771, Indonesia
review 1: Great relaxed vibe with beautiful view. Amazing food. Get the seafood nasi goreng as they pack it with stuff and will be one of the better ones you‚Äôve had. Came here straight away the day after. Also smoothie bowls !
review 2: Perfect match between food, price and view. We got the chicken curry and the chicken wrap, very tasty food and amazing fresh juices
review 3:
Spent two sunsets here in mid-March. Everything about this place is perfect - food, drinks, service, atmosphere.

The setting is perfect at this time for sunset over the seaweed bay.

Made and his family are the perfect hosts.
review 4: This restaurant is all perfect for a nice dinner with a sunset view. The owners of the restaurant  are treating you like family. We will come back. We can recommend the Chicken Rendang- it was amazing!
review 5: Overall great service, fantastic places to sit, a very diverse menu of all of the things I love, gorgeous beachfront views, and beautiful art! They even have hammocks you can sit on! I loved my dragon smoothie bowl and small tuna salad, as well as my iced lemon tea.

name: Villa Chama
address: 8F23+25V, Jl. Nusa Ceningan, Lembongan, Kec. Nusa Penida, Kabupaten Klungkung, Bali 80771, Indonesia
review 1: Such a great villa for a gateway. I went with a group of 8 people and everyone was very pleased. The view is AMAZING as it's located on top of the hill. Stylish villa with attentive staffs. They organized the scooter, snorkeling trip and surf trip. I will come back!
review 2: We spent 3 nights with my family in this beautiful villa nestled in the hills of Nusa Ceningan. The scenery from the balcony is breathtaking with an amazing view of Lembongan, its turquoise blue water lagoon and the majestic Mt Agung! On the best view I have ever seen. The Villa is very well decorated and the staff very helpful. I highly recommend Villa Chama to spend a week-end or more! We will be back soon
review 3: Amazing Villa on the hills of Nusa Ceningan. True dream vacation spot. I experienced one the most beautiful sunset in this well built villa. Staff is very professional and so friendly that you want to hug them.
review 4: Amazing place to stay ... The view is just the best on the island. Even our surf teacher , who  borned and raised there, were amazed by the villa and view. super quiet environment, staff so nice and helpful... It will remain the best villa we visited during our entire trip in Bali and Lombok. Highly recommend !
review 5: 5 Star Plus!!! We really enjoyed our stay at beautiful Villa Chama. The View was incredible, rooms were very super clean and stylish. Best place to stay in Nusa Ceningan.

name: Sunset House Ceningan
address: Jalan Raya Ceningan Nusa, Lembongan, Kec. Nusa Penida, Kabupaten Klungkung, Bali 80771, Indonesia
review 1:
Amazing service, location and villa on Ceningan.
Ketut and his team are extremely efficient, friendly and the villa is so beautiful.
The cafes/restaurants and massage places will come to you.
The staff will pick up from yellow bridge and transport people and luggage. They can organise snorkelling and transport if you don‚Äôt want to rent a scooter. They replenish the Bintangs and are there if you need anything. Service is 10 stars :)
We will be back, thank you to the team xxx
review 2:
Our stay at this place was quite disappointing. The accommodations were far from what we expected based on the pictures and descriptions. The room was not well-maintained, and cleanliness was a concern. The staff seemed disinterested in addressing our concerns and providing assistance.

To make matters worse, the staff accused us of stealing their air conditioner remote, which was both surprising and unsettling. They also displayed dissatisfaction with the tip we provided, despite the fact that tipping is not mandatory and should reflect the quality of service received.

Furthermore, seeking local recommendations seemed to annoy the staff rather than elicit helpful responses. Their uncooperative attitude put a damper on our experience and left us feeling unwelcome.

Overall, it was an unpleasant and uncomfortable stay. I would not recommend staying here given the poor service, unfounded accusations, and lack of basic hospitality.
review 3: My family had the most incredible stay at Sunset House from the view right to the service. Ketut, Ketut‚Äôs wife and Kadek are so warm and friendly, and go above and beyond to provide an amazing service.  We felt right at home and can‚Äôt wait to visit this slice of paradise again!
review 4: Brand New the Villa and New lovely Owner.Amazing sunset view and right front the beach.very recommened.
review 5: Three lovely bungalows, private, clean and spacious. Great views of the bay from the pool area. Brilliant location, just minutes away from a good selection of bars and restaurants. The family that run the bungalows are so welcoming and even invited us to watch their celebration ceremony for a Balinese feast day and gifted us a basket of local fresh fruit afterwards. Breakfast is eggs and toast with coffee/tea/juice. Extremely peaceful and relaxing. We loved it so much that we extended twice, staying a total of 7 nights after originally booking 2. Amazing value for money, we would definitely recommend and stay again. Such a gem, we're so happy to have found it. Also, if you arrive and no one is there when you arrive just drop them a whatsapp (number is on the desk along with wifi password) and they will arrive within 5 mins to help.

name: DT Nusa Ceningan
address: Jl. Nusa Ceningan, Lembongan, Kec. Nusa Penida, Kabupaten Klungkung, Bali 80771, Indonesia
review 1: By chance I stopped by with a friend for a coconut and had a wonderful time. We virtually had the place to ourselves and Pak Made put some music on and made us feel right at home. You can go down the steps to the water and lie on the hammock or swing. Shame there weren‚Äôt that many people there. Would definitely recommend!
review 2: We ate here at 5pm. food was fantastic and well priced. it was not busy. and we had 2 friendly little helpers to feed our left over meat to. view and atmosphere was relaxing. happy hour is 4pm to 7pm (get 3 drinks, pay for 2)
review 3: Very good little restaurant with a very nice view on the beach and the yellow bridge. You can order some good food and some really tasty cocktail with or without alcool. Its a bit busy during the high season but it deserve the stop to see it. You may actually seen many pictures of it on google with a little spot where you can sit the feet on the water balancing yourself over the sea...like on the pictures I added just below...
review 4: Our most favorite beach club restaurant in Ceningan with friendly people and great food! The server checked your food and drinks after they are served. Had a scratch from falling over motorbike and a server was kind to get first aid. They also don‚Äôt use plastic straw (like other beach club here).
review 5: Testy, fresh meals. I love their banana smoothie. Place is relaxing with nice sea view.

name: Warung Sekedar
address: 8F32+72H, Jl. Nusa Ceningan, Lembongan, Kec. Nusa Penida, Kabupaten Klungkung, Bali 80771, Indonesia

name: The Bridge Kubu
address: Jl. Yellow Bridge, Lembongan, Kec. Nusa Penida, Kabupaten Klungkung, Bali 80771, Indonesia

name: D‚ÄôPasih Ceningan
address: 8C2X+Q7H, Jl. Nusa Ceningan, Lembongan, Kec. Nusa Penida, Kabupaten Klungkung, Bali 80771, Indonesia
review 1:
This is a lovely place, quiet, only 4 rooms- all have a terrasse.
Nice view.
Good breakfast.
Hot water, AC, the beds are huge and extremely comfortable.
Dont hesitate!
review 2:
Nice service from staff & onwer,
Very friendly.
Ocean view & good view.
review 3: Amazing place, beachfronts, good staff. Hope can back again next time
review 4: Good place for stay, quite and relax!

name: Ceningan Inn
address: 8F32+FCP, Lembongan, Nusa Penida, Klungkung Regency, Bali 80771, Indonesia
review 1: The host and his family are very friendly and helpful all the time, they help you wherever they can and arrange everything you want to do and are very kind all the time. Sometimes they gave me a plate of fresh fruits for free, they're cleaning the room mostly every second day, make your laundry if you want to, also drove me to the boat for free when I leaved. the accommodation and the rooms are clean and groomed. The outdoor bathroom is a really cool experience. The rooms are large and simply furnished, but you got everything you need, ac and big fan in every room. Bathroom is spartanic but honestly, you will find that at the most low budget rooms in the whole area of this island and the islands around. You get used to it fast and also you can't expect European standards for bathrooms in indonesia. Cost-performance Ratio very Good! Highly recommended!
review 2: The room is spacious, good AC, nice staff and very helpful, easy to access this property because near from yellow bridge.
review 3: Nice and clean. Close to the beach.  It is still under construction but nicely done.
review 4: Lovely family run place. Simple but nice and great location

name: Mata Lebaoh Homestay
address: Nusa Ceningan Nusa Lembongan, 7CXX+35X, Lembongan, Kec. Nusa Penida, Kabupaten Klungkung, Bali 80711, Indonesia
review 1: Amazing place, host was one of the nicest people we met in indonesia. I recommend renting a motorbike and going around the island. If you need anything, ask the host and he will help you.
review 2: lovely place, fresh air and very friendly host üôè‚ò∫
